Hello Thiru:

There may be some misunderstanding.

Heritrix does its best at downloading whatever is presented by the 
server saving to disk exactly what was served.  No conversion is done on 
the raw downloads.  This is intentional.  We're trying 'archive' exactly 
what we read from the servers.

Later when processors run, they want to do various analysis against the 
downloaded content:  e.g. the ExtractorHTML will try and pull links out 
of HTML pages.  Dependent on the processor, they'll want to look at the 
download as characters rather than as raw bytes. For example, they may 
want to regex over a character stream to find links.  At this time, 
we'll provide a charset to the character reader so it does appropriate 
translation of raw bytes.  Regards the charset, Heritrix is a little 
lame.  We just use the charset from the HTTP Response headers.  If none, 
we default to ISO-8859-1.  The charset on the HTTP Response is very 
often wrong so when processors go to read, they'll be reading mangled 
characters.

We have an RFE to add a charset guesser to the processing stream: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=899909&group_id=73833&atid=539102.

Is this what you were thinking?
Yours,
St.Ack
